title: [Large-Scale] Strategy Design Course for Developing Public Academic Librariesâ€™ Absorptive Capacity (AC)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of library operations and organizational management
context.additional_context: Aims to enhance absorptive capacity for public academic library managers/leaders within companies, combining theory and practice in digital device-supported environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three components of absorptive capacity (AC) in public academic libraries at individual and organizational levels.
Learners can apply key qualitative-survey research methodologies (coding, categorization, paradigm pattern design) to analyze cases for AC development.
Learners can derive AC development strategies at the organizational level (contextual conditions, mediating conditions, strategic conditions) and incorporate them into library innovation plans.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
